title: Phase I Cancer Clinical Trial Design: Stochastic Optimization and Practical Application

context.prior_knowledge: Basic statistics, understanding of clinical trial phases, and principles of cancer treatment
context.additional_context: Operated via PBL (Project-Based Learning) in smartphone-centric constrained technical environments, involving project execution that analyzes and reconstructs actual clinical trial design cases

learning_goals: Learners can model dose-determination algorithms in Phase I clinical trials as stochastic optimization problems.
Can apply the combined principles of Bayesian optimal design and c-optimal design in practical settings
Can design dose-escalation strategies to resolve the treatment-exploration dilemma under constraints

resources: Clinical trial design case study materials
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
